content.rendered:
What is a Medical Secretary?

Medical Secretaries are in charge of scheduling patients medical appointments, handling communications, updating files/charts and database management.

Where does a Medical Secretary work?

  • Physicians’ offices
  • Hospitals
  • Clinics
  • Surgical facilities

How much does a Medical Secretary make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Medical Secretary is $34,000.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Medical Secretaries?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Anatomy majors
  • Business majors
  • Biology majors
Explore jobs on Handshake

Medical Secretary skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Medical Secretaries succeed in their work:

  • High levels of organization
  • Great office management skills
  • Good customer service

What are some common questions about Medical Secretaries?

Q: What qualifications do I need to become a Medical Secretary?

A: Other than a high school degree, most employers would look highly upon good customer service, keyboard, and management skills.
